recipes.name: Miso Braised Tofu
ingredients: 24 ounces extra-firm tofu, drained and pressed
2 to 3 tablespoons sweet white rice flour (mochiko)
1/2 cup fresh orange juice (from approximately 2 large oranges)
Neutral oil for frying (such as grapeseed oil)
1 1/2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and cut into matchsticks
directions: Step 1: Gather all the ingredients and necessary tools for the recipe.
Step 2: Press the tofu by placing it on an upside-down plate with another plate on top, weighted down with a heavy object. Allow to drain for about 15 minutes.
Step 3: After pressing, blot the tofu dry with a clean towel. Slice into 1/2-inch thick pieces, yielding approximately 10 pieces per block.
Step 4: Place the rice flour in a shallow dish. Set a rimmed baking sheet next to it to hold the coated tofu.
Step 5: Dredge each slice of tofu in the rice flour, ensuring all sides are coated. Arrange the dredged tofu on the baking sheet.
Step 6: In a liquid measuring cup, mix the orange juice and sambal oelek chili paste with 1/2 cup water.
Step 7: Heat a large wok or a 10-inch cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add enough oil to create a 1/2-inch depth, heating it until shimmering.
Step 8: Carefully add tofu pieces to the hot oil in a single layer, being sure they do not touch. Fry without flipping for about 3 minutes until golden and crisp.
Step 9: Flip the tofu and continue frying for an additional 2 to 3 minutes until both sides are golden brown and crispy. Transfer the tofu back to the baking sheet.
Step 10: After frying all tofu, carefully pour excess oil from the wok, leaving a light coating. Wipe out any excess rice flour.
Step 11: Lower the heat to medium-low and add the ginger and garlic to the wok, cooking until fragrant and the garlic turns golden.
Step 12: Add ground coriander to the wok and stir until aromatic. Cook until the garlic is lightly browned.
Step 13: Pour in the orange juice and sambal mixture, stirring to deglaze the pan. Simmer until the mixture reduces by about a quarter.
Step 14: Dissolve the white miso paste in 1/4 cup water and stir it into the simmering sauce in the wok.
Step 15: Add the fried tofu back into the wok, coating it thoroughly with the sauce. Cover and cook on low heat for about 5 minutes, allowing the tofu to absorb the flavors and the sauce to thicken.
Step 16: Transfer the miso braised tofu to a serving dish and garnish with orange slices and fresh cilantro sprigs, if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant shot of Miso Braised Tofu, styled on a rustic wooden table. Use a shallow depth of field to focus on the glossy, caramelized tofu, emphasizing its rich texture. Surround the dish with fresh orange slices and a scattering of ginger and garlic for added color. Use natural light to create soft shadows, enhancing the warm tones. A low angle will reveal the dish’s height and layers, evoking a cozy, inviting mood perfect for a culinary magazine spread.

recipes.name: Dry-Fried Tofu with Marinade
ingredients: 1 to 1.5 cups of store-bought or homemade marinade
directions: Step 1: Begin by ensuring you have water-packed extra-firm tofu, avoiding silken tofu found in aseptic boxes.
Step 2: Heat a non-stick pan or a well-seasoned cast-iron pan over medium heat if using an electric stove, or low to medium-low heat on a gas stove.
Step 3: Cut the block of tofu in half lengthwise.
Step 4: Place the tofu halves between paper towels or clean dish towels and press gently to remove some moisture without squishing it.
Step 5: Cut the pressed tofu into approximately 16 triangles or strips.
Step 6: Add the tofu pieces to the heated pan, leaving plenty of space around each piece. Consider cooking in two batches if necessary.
Step 7: Cook the tofu very slowly over low to medium heat; slow cooking helps prevent sticking and allows time for moisture evaporation.
Step 8: Do not add oil; this method relies on dry cooking to remove excess water.
Step 9: As the tofu cooks, frequently use a spatula to press down on each piece, watching for water to squeeze out and sizzle in the pan.
Step 10: When the bottom sides are firm and golden, carefully flip the pieces to cook the other sides.
Step 11: Continue cooking until both sides are firm and golden, indicating most of the moisture has evaporated and the tofu is ready to absorb marinade.
Step 12: Place the cooked tofu in your marinade of choice, stir gently to coat, and let it marinate for about 30 minutes.
Step 13: The marinated tofu is now ready to be served or used in a stir-fry.
Step 14: Uncooked leftover tofu should be placed in a lidded container submerged in water, sealed, and stored in the refrigerator.
Step 15: Remember to change the water every day or two until used.
Step 16: Store cooked tofu as you would any other leftovers.

recipes.name: Crispy Air-Fried Tofu
ingredients: 8 ounces firm tofu, drained and pressed
directions: Step 1: Place the pressed tofu on a plate lined with several paper towels. Cover it with additional paper towels and another plate. Set a weight (3 to 5 pounds) on top and press the tofu for 30 minutes. Discard any accumulated liquid and cut the tofu into 1/2-inch cubes.
Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the low-sodium soy sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, and sesame oil. Mix well and add the tofu cubes, marinating them for 15 to 20 minutes.
Step 3: Preheat your air fryer to 350°F (180°C).
Step 4: Place the marinated tofu in a single layer in the air fryer basket.
Step 5: Air fry the tofu for 5 minutes without shaking. Continue air frying, shaking the basket occasionally, until the tofu is browned, about 10 more minutes.

recipes.name: Pan-Fried Agedashi Tofu with Shishito Peppers
ingredients: 14 oz block of very soft tofu, drained and cut into 1/2 in cubes
4 to 5 tablespoons potato starch, for coating
3 to 4 whole shishito peppers, left whole
Enough olive oil to coat the pan and prevent sticking
Grated daikon (Japanese radish) or ginger, optional
directions: 1. Drain the tofu and cut it into small cubes, approximately 1/2 inch by 1/2 inch.
2. Place the tofu on a layer of paper towels to absorb excess moisture. Dab the top side with another paper towel, ensuring some moisture remains to help the starch adhere.
3. Sprinkle the potato starch over the tofu and coat each cube well to create a crispy exterior.
4. Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add olive oil until it shimmers.
5. Once the oil is hot, gently add the tofu cubes, frying each side until slightly browned while being careful not to break them.
6. Add the shishito peppers between the tofu cubes in the pan and fry until they are slightly browned. Remove the peppers once cooked, and repeat with any additional peppers if desired.
7. While the tofu is cooking, prepare the sauce by combining the dashi stock, soy sauce, and mirin in a small pot.
8. Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 4 to 5 minutes before removing it from heat.
9. Once the tofu is golden brown on all sides, remove it from the pan and place it on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil.
10. Serve the tofu in a small bowl, drizzling the prepared sauce over it, and garnish with chopped green onions and optional grated daikon or ginger.

recipes.name: Marinated Tofu Burger with Creamy Mushroom Sauce
ingredients: 1 block (18 oz) firm tofu, pressed and sliced into thick burgers
4 leaves of lettuce, washed and dried
1 tablespoon (15ml) date honey or maple syrup
½ teaspoon chili and garlic spice
directions: 1. Press the tofu by wrapping it in a clean towel and placing a heavy object on top for 20 minutes.
2. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
3. After pressing, cut the tofu into thick square burgers.
4. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the tofu burgers on it.
5. Bake the tofu in the oven for 40 minutes, turning the burgers halfway through at 20 minutes.
6. In a bowl, combine soy sauce, date honey (or maple syrup), peanut butter, and chili and garlic spice to make the marinade.
7. Once the tofu is baked, transfer it to a dish and pour the marinade over the burgers. Let them marinate while you prepare the mushroom sauce.
8. In a pan, sauté the chopped mushrooms over medium-high heat with the remaining soy sauce covered with a lid until they release their moisture.
9. Remove the lid and continue to cook until most of the water evaporates.
10. Stir in the coconut cream and simmer for 1 minute.
11. In a small bowl, mix the flour with a small amount of leftover coconut cream or water to create a thick paste before adding it to the mushroom sauce.
12. Allow the mushroom sauce to boil for a couple of minutes to thicken slightly before removing from heat.
13. Once the sauce is cooling, remove the tofu burgers from the marinade using a slotted spatula.
14. Brown the marinated tofu burgers for a few minutes on each side in a skillet until golden.
15. Assemble your burgers by placing browned tofu on toasted buns, adding lettuce and tomato, and topping with the creamy mushroom sauce; alternatively, serve the sauce on the side.

recipes.name: Crispy Marinated Tofu for Meat-Lovers
ingredients: 1 package (14 ounces) extra firm tofu, pressed and sliced
1 cup spicy peanut satay sauce (for marinating)
directions: Step 1: Place the package of extra firm tofu in the freezer and freeze for at least 24 hours.
Step 2: After freezing, defrost the tofu by placing the still-packaged tofu in a pot of boiling water for about 10 minutes.
Step 3: Carefully remove the tofu from its packaging and cut it in half horizontally to create two thinner slabs.
Step 4: Slice each slab lengthwise into three equal strips, then place the tofu pieces on a clean dish towel or paper towels.
Step 5: Cover the tofu with another towel and place a cutting board or baking tray on top, adding weights (such as heavy cans) to press the tofu for 15-30 minutes.
Step 6: Cut the pressed tofu into bite-sized cubes and marinate them in the spicy peanut sauce for a minimum of 30 minutes.
Step 7: Remove the tofu from the marinade and dust the cubes with flour to ensure an even coating.
Step 8: Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat, then shallow fry the tofu cubes until all sides are golden brown and crispy.
Step 9: Serve hot with rice or couscous, accompanied by additional peanut sauce for dipping.

ingredients: 1 block (14 oz) extra-firm tofu, drained and pressed
⅓ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
¼ cup vegan Buffalo wing sauce (such as Frank's®)
directions: Step 1: Remove the tofu from the package, discard the liquid, and wrap the tofu in cheesecloth. Place it on a plate, cover with a heavy pot, and allow the excess liquid to drain for approximately 10 minutes.
Step 2: Remove the cheesecloth and cut the tofu into 20 bite-sized pieces, approximately 1 inch each. Freeze the pieces in a freezer-safe container for at least 8 hours or overnight.
Step 3: After freezing, remove the tofu from the freezer and thaw it on paper towels or a dry cheesecloth. Pat the tofu dry to remove excess moisture.
Step 4: While the tofu is thawing, place the cornstarch in a resealable plastic bag and pour the rice milk into a small bowl.
Step 5: Preheat an air fryer to 375°F (190°C).
Step 6: Add the thawed tofu pieces to the bag with cornstarch, seal it, and shake until the tofu is evenly coated. Remove the tofu pieces and dip each one in rice milk.

Step 7: Combine the panko bread crumbs, garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, and black pepper in the resealable plastic bag. Shake until well mixed, then coat each tofu piece with the breadcrumb mixture, tapping off the excess. Place the coated tofu on a wire rack.

Step 8: Add the coated tofu to the air fryer basket and cook for 10 minutes. Shake the basket gently to loosen the pieces and continue cooking for an additional 3 minutes, or until the tofu is browned and crispy.
Step 9: In a bowl, combine ⅓ cup of the Buffalo sauce with the cooked tofu bites. Toss to coat the tofu evenly. Drizzle any remaining Buffalo sauce over the tofu before serving.

recipes.name: Marinated Fried Tofu
ingredients: 1 pound extra-firm tofu, drained and cut into 1/2-inch thick triangles
1 tablespoon peanut oil or vegetable oil, for stir-frying
1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine, or more as needed
1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips
directions: 1: Gather all the ingredients.
2: Drain the tofu and set aside.

3: In a bowl, prepare the marinade by whisking together the rice vinegar, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, extra-virgin olive oil, garlic, Asian sesame oil, sugar, and chili paste. Cover the bowl and refrigerate while you dry-fry the tofu.
4: Cut the drained tofu into triangles about 1/2 inch thick. Dry-fry the tofu in a non-stick pan until golden brown on each side.

5: Remove the marinade from the refrigerator and pour it into a large resealable plastic bag. Add the dry-fried tofu to the bag. Seal and refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally to ensure all tofu is marinated.
6: The next day, prepare the vegetables for stir-frying. Remove the tofu from the bag and reserve the marinade.
7: Preheat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil or vegetable oil. Once hot, add the ginger slices and stir for a few seconds until fragrant.
8: Add the chopped onions and sliced mushrooms to the wok. Stir-fry for 2 minutes, adding Chinese rice wine if the vegetables begin to dry out.

9: Add the red bell pepper strips to the wok. Stir briefly, and then add the baby corn. Stir-fry for another minute before adding the marinated tofu slices. Heat through while gently turning the tofu.

10: Push the vegetables and tofu to the sides of the wok. Pour the reserved marinade into the center and bring it to a boil. In a small dish, mix the cornstarch with the water, then add it to the boiling marinade, stirring quickly to thicken.
11: Stir to combine the sauce with the tofu and vegetables. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Serve hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Tofu Banh Mi
ingredients: 8 ounces extra-firm tofu, drained and pressed
1/2 jalapeño, seeded and cut into thin rings
A few fresh sprigs of cilantro
1/4 jalapeño, seeded and cut into thin rings
directions: Step 1: In a large, shallow dish, combine the ingredients for the tofu marinade excluding the cooking oil. Slice the tofu into 1/4 inch thick slices, and arrange them in the marinade, ensuring they are completely submerged. Allow to marinate for at least 1 hour.
Step 2: In a small bowl, mix together the ingredients for the pickled vegetables. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.
Step 3: In another small bowl, whisk together the ingredients for the creamy Banh Mi sauce. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Step 4: After marinating, heat the cooking oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully add the marinated tofu. Cook for approximately 5 minutes per side, or until the tofu is dark and crispy.

Step 5: Cut the baguette in half lengthwise. Generously spread the creamy Banh Mi sauce over both sides of each half. Load the cooked tofu, followed by a handful of the pickled carrots and cucumbers. Top with fresh cilantro and jalapeño rings. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tofu Gyros with Cucumber Sauce
ingredients: 1/2 lb (225 g) extra firm tofu, drained and pressed
1/2 cup cucumber, peeled and finely chopped
2 teaspoons flaxseed oil or olive oil
2-3 pinches ground black pepper, or to taste
6-8 whole wheat pita breads (8 inches each)
4 green onions, sliced or 1 medium onion, thinly sliced
directions: 1. If desired, freeze the extra firm tofu overnight for a chewier texture. Allow it to thaw in the refrigerator for a couple of days.
2. Cut the tofu into 8 slices and place them on a clean dishtowel. Fold the towel over and press gently to extract excess moisture.
3. Cut each tofu slice in half lengthwise.
4. In a medium bowl, combine tamari, dried oregano, ground rosemary, and garlic powder to create a marinade.
5. Place the tofu slices in a shallow container and pour the marinade over them, flipping to ensure even coating. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight in the refrigerator.

6. For the cucumber sauce, combine silken tofu, chopped cucumber, flaxseed oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Blend until fairly smooth, but still chunky. Adjust seasoning as necessary and refrigerate until ready to use.
7. Just before serving, heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the marinated tofu strips and cook until golden brown on both sides, turning frequently.
8. To assemble, place 2-3 tofu strips in the center of a pita, top with romaine lettuce, sliced tomatoes, and green onions. Drizzle cucumber sauce over the top.
9. Fold the pita in half, pick it up and enjoy like a taco!

recipes.name: Spicy Tofu Tandoori Skewers
ingredients: 2/3 cup plain yogurt or vegan non-dairy yogurt
1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, to taste
1 pound firm tofu, pressed and cubed
directions: Step 1: Press the tofu to remove excess moisture, allowing it to better absorb the marinade.
Step 2: Soak bamboo skewers in water for at least 30 minutes to prevent burning on the grill.
Step 3: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lime juice, tandoori spice blend, garlic powder, ground ginger, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper until smooth and well combined.
Step 4: Add the pressed tofu cubes to the marinade, ensuring all pieces are thoroughly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, turning occasionally to enhance marination.
Step 5: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. While heating, thread the marinated tofu onto the soaked skewers.
Step 6: Grill the skewers for 6 to 8 minutes, turning once or twice, until the tofu is golden and crisp.
Step 7: Serve the tandoori tofu skewers hot, optionally paired with fresh homemade cucumber raita.

recipes.name: Vegan Tofu Scramble
ingredients: 1 block (14 oz) firm tofu, drained and pressed
directions: Step 1: Gather all the ingredients before starting the cooking process.
Step 2: Prepare the tofu by pressing it to remove excess moisture. Aim for at least 15 minutes for best results.
Step 3: Cut the pressed tofu into approximately 1-inch cubes.
Step 4: Crumble the tofu slightly using your hands or a fork to achieve a scramble-like consistency.
Step 5: Heat the vegetable oil or margarine in a large skillet over medium heat.
Step 6: Add the diced onion, diced green bell pepper, and crumbled tofu to the skillet. Sauté for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently.

Step 7: Sprinkle in the garlic powder, onion powder, and soy sauce. Reduce the heat to medium and continue cooking for an additional 5 to 7 minutes, stirring often. If the mixture begins to stick, add a little more oil.
Step 8: Stir in the nutritional yeast and mix until the tofu is well-coated and heated through.
Step 9: Serve the tofu scramble as is, or customize by topping with salsa, wrapping in a warmed flour tortilla for a breakfast burrito, or adding soy or dairy cheese.

recipes.name: Crispy Tofu Buffalo Wings
ingredients: 12 ounces extra-firm tofu, drained and pressed
1 tablespoon hot sauce, or to taste
directions: Step 1: Drain the tofu and remove excess moisture by cutting it in half lengthwise. Microwave the tofu on high, uncovered, for two minutes.
Step 2: Gently squeeze out any remaining moisture and wipe the tofu. Freeze the tofu for one to two hours, then thaw it in the refrigerator to achieve a firmer texture.
Step 3: Cut the thawed tofu into bite-sized pieces and place them in a lidded, flat-bottomed dish for marinating.
Step 4: In a small bowl, combine the hot sauce, barbecue sauce, black pepper, and garlic powder.
Step 5: Pour half of this sauce mixture over the tofu, reserving the other half for later. Allow the tofu to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Step 6: Drain any excess marinade from the tofu into the reserved bowl of sauce.
Step 7: In a separate bowl, combine the flour, salt, cayenne pepper, and paprika.
Step 8: Coat the marinated tofu pieces in the flour mixture.
Step 9: Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the coated tofu in batches until all sides are golden brown and crispy.
Step 10: Add the remaining sauce mixture to the pan, stirring to coat the fried tofu evenly.
Step 11: Serve the crispy tofu buffalo wings with your choice of ranch or bleu cheese dressing for dipping.

recipes.name: Crispy Tofu Bowl with Baby Potatoes and Mustard Coconut Dressing
ingredients: 400 grams extra firm tofu, drained and pressed
1 tablespoon tamarind sauce or soy sauce
200 grams baby potatoes, washed and halved
150 grams mixed salad greens or fresh spinach leaves, rinsed and chopped
1 tablespoon olive oil, for the dressing
directions: Step 1: Cook the halved baby potatoes in a large pot of boiling water for about 20 minutes. You can begin preparing the mustard coconut dressing and crispy tofu while the potatoes are cooking.
Step 2: Drain the cooked potatoes and allow them to cool to room temperature.
Step 3: Wash the mixed salad greens and divide them evenly between two large bowls.
Step 4: Slice the cucumber and add the pieces to the bowls with the salad greens.
Step 5: Once the potatoes have cooled, add them to the salad bowls.
Step 6: In a small mixing bowl, combine the mustard, coconut cream, lemon juice, salt, and pepper, and mix until well combined.
Step 7: Place the tofu on a large plate or cutting board and slice it lengthwise into six pieces.
Step 8: Turn the tofu pieces on their widest side and place a kitchen towel or a few layers of kitchen paper on top of them.
Step 9: Place a heavy pot on the tofu slices and let the tofu rest under the weight for 10 minutes.
Step 10: Transfer the pressed tofu to a new plate. Sprinkle the cornstarch over the tofu, followed by the olive oil and tamarind sauce.
Step 11: Gently toss the tofu to ensure it is evenly coated with the mixture.
Step 12: Heat a frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat and add the grapeseed oil.
Step 13: Add the tofu slices in a single layer and fry for a few minutes. Wait until the tofu releases from the pan before turning to ensure crispiness.
Step 14: Once one side is golden brown, turn the tofu and fry the other sides until all faces are crispy and brown.
Step 15: Transfer the crispy tofu to a cooling rack or kitchen paper to drain excess oil.
Step 16: Divide the crispy tofu among the salad bowls, drizzle 1-2 tablespoons of mustard coconut dressing, and sprinkle 1-2 teaspoons of sesame seeds over each bowl.
Step 17: Serve immediately while warm.

recipes.name: Tibetan Greens with Tofu (Tse Tofu)
ingredients: 1 bunch Swiss chard, washed and torn into pieces, stems removed
4 (12-ounce) blocks firm tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Step 1: In a frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
Step 2: Add the chopped green onions, paprika, ginger, and 2 cloves of garlic; stir-fry until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Step 3: Stir in soy sauce, tofu cubes, and green peas; cook for an additional 5 minutes until heated through.
Step 4: In a separate frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil until very hot.
Step 5: Add ground black pepper to the hot oil.
Step 6: Add the Swiss chard, which should be slightly wet, into the frying pan; toss to coat with oil and pepper.
Step 7: Cover the pan and let steam for about 30 seconds.
Step 8: Transfer the sautéed Swiss chard to a serving platter and pour the tofu mixture over the greens.

recipes.name: Ma Po Tofu (Braised Spicy Pork with Tofu)
ingredients: 1 ounce gingerroot, sliced into 1/4 inch pieces
14 ounces firm tofu, drained and cut into 1-inch cubes
2 teaspoons garlic and red chile paste, or to taste
directions: Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in a wok over medium-high heat for 2 minutes.
Step 2: Prepare all ingredients and have them ready beside your cooking area, as they will be needed quickly while cooking.
Step 3: Add minced garlic and sliced ginger to the wok, and stir-fry for about 1 minute, being careful not to burn the garlic.
Step 4: Add ground pork to the wok and break it up into large chunks. Let the pork sear for about 3-4 minutes, gently combining it with the garlic and ginger.
Step 5: Optional: Season the pork with salt and black pepper to taste.
Step 6: In a small bowl, combine sugar, Shao Xing cooking wine, Chinese rice wine, sesame oil, dark soy sauce, and garlic and red chile paste to create the sauce mixture.
Step 7: Add the sauce mixture to the wok and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Step 8: Gently add green onions, tofu, and 1/2 cup of chicken broth to the wok.
Step 9: Carefully fold the ingredients together, making sure not to break the tofu.
Step 10: Cover the wok with a lid and reduce the heat to low. Braise the pork and tofu for 10 minutes.
Step 11: Remove the lid and increase the heat to medium.
Step 12: To thicken the sauce, stir cornstarch into the remaining 1/2 cup of chicken broth to make a slurry.
Step 13: Add the slurry to the wok and gently stir until the sauce thickens, about 2 minutes.
Step 14: If desired, remove ginger slices before serving.
Step 15: Serve hot over white rice and enjoy!

recipes.name: Vegan General Tso's Tofu
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) container extra firm tofu, drained and cut into 1-inch cubes
2 large eggs, beaten (or egg replacer for a Vegan option)
directions: Step 1: Drain the tofu and chop it into 1-inch cubes. Press the cubes between two towels to remove excess moisture.

Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine rice vinegar, rice wine, soy sauce, minced garlic, minced ginger, 2 tablespoons of sesame oil, and chili oil to taste. Add the tofu cubes, cover, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or preferably overnight.
Step 3: Remove the marinated tofu from the refrigerator and pat dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture.
Step 4: In another bowl, mix the marinade with 5 teaspoons of cornstarch and 1/2 cup of sugar. Whisk until smooth.
Step 5: In a large saucepan, bring the marinade mixture to a boil over medium-low heat, stirring continuously until thickened. Remove from heat.
Step 6: Beat the eggs in a shallow dish. Dip each tofu cube in the beaten eggs, ensuring all sides are coated, then place them on a paper towel to drain excess egg.
Step 7: Over a plate, toss the egg-coated tofu in 1/2 cup of cornstarch to lightly coat all sides. Shake off any excess cornstarch.
Step 8: Heat 1/2 cup of vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the coated tofu cubes, frying until golden brown and crispy on all sides.
Step 9: Once the tofu is browned, transfer it to a paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil.
Step 10: In a large bowl, combine the fried tofu with the prepared General Tso's sauce and heat over low for 3-5 minutes until everything is warmed through. Serve and enjoy.

recipes.name: Korean BBQ Tofu Sliders with Kimchi Slaw
ingredients: Nonstick cooking spray, for greasing the baking pan
16 ounces baked tofu, cut into 8 rectangles
2 tablespoons soy sauce, for kimchi slaw
1 tablespoon rice vinegar, for kimchi slaw
1 large garlic clove, grated, for kimchi slaw
1/2 small Napa cabbage, cored and thinly sliced
A few lettuce leaves, for serving
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Spray a 9 x 13-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
3. Place the cut tofu rectangles in the prepared baking pan. Set aside.
4. In a small pot, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, water, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sriracha, grated garlic, and grated ginger.
5. Bring the sauce to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
6. Pour the sauce over the tofu in the baking pan.
7. Bake the tofu for 10 minutes, then carefully flip each piece over.
8. Return the tofu to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Flip again and bake for another 10 minutes, for a total of 30 minutes, until the sauce thickens and coats the tofu.
9. Once baked, remove the tofu from the oven and toss it in the sauce to ensure it is well coated.
10. Sprinkle the baked tofu with sesame seeds.
11. Meanwhile, prepare the kimchi slaw by mixing soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, sriracha, grated garlic, and grated ginger in a bowl.
12. Add the sliced Napa cabbage, julienned carrots, and sliced green onion to the bowl, then mix well to combine. Set aside until tofu is ready.
13. To assemble the sliders, place a lettuce leaf on each slider bun, add a piece of tofu, and top with a generous spoonful of kimchi slaw.
14. Serve immediately and enjoy!

recipes.name: Chinese Bourbon Tofu
ingredients: 12 ounces extra-firm tofu, drained and pressed
directions: Step 1: Drain the tofu and cut it in half lengthwise. Microwave on high, uncovered, for two minutes to remove excess moisture.

Step 2: Gently squeeze out and wipe off any remaining moisture. Freeze the tofu for one to two hours, then remove and thaw in the refrigerator to achieve a firmer texture. Cut the thawed tofu into bite-sized pieces.
Step 3: In a small bowl, combine minced garlic, ground ginger, crushed red pepper flakes, apple juice, brown sugar, ketchup, apple cider vinegar, water, and soy sauce. Mix well.

Step 4: Pour half of the marinade over the tofu, reserving the other half for later use. Let the tofu marinate for at least 30 minutes. Drain any excess marinade from the tofu and set aside for later.
Step 5: Coat the marinated tofu pieces in all-purpose flour, ensuring they are evenly covered.
Step 6: Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large frying pan. Fry the coated tofu until golden brown on all sides. Add more oil as needed, but allow it to cook out before proceeding.
Step 7: Add the reserved marinade to the pan, bring it to a boil, then lower the heat and let it simmer for 20 minutes.
Step 8: Serve the Bourbon Tofu over rice.

Use a dark, textured wooden table as the background to enhance the dish's warm tones. Incorporate fresh green scallions and sesame seeds as garnishes for contrast. Position the plate at a 45-degree angle for dynamic composition. Utilize soft, diffused natural light to emphasize the tofu's texture, maintaining a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the dish while softly blurring the background. Aim for a warm, inviting mood to tantalize the viewer.

recipes.name: Marinated Tofu and Green Bean Salad
ingredients: 10 ounces firm tofu, drained and cubed
1 pound green beans, trimmed and cut in half
1 pinch chili flakes, or more for desired spice level
Optional: 1-2 cups baby kale or baby spinach
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C).
Step 2: Drain the tofu and pat it dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture. Cut the tofu into cubes and set aside.
Step 3: In a blender, combine the tamari sauce, toasted sesame oil, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and chili flakes to make the marinade.

Step 4: Transfer the marinade to a large ziplock bag and add the tofu cubes. Seal the bag and gently shake to ensure the tofu is evenly coated. Refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours, preferably overnight.
Step 5: After marinating, line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Arrange the marinated tofu cubes on the sheet in a single layer and bake for 20-25 minutes until firm and slightly golden.
Step 6: In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of coconut oil over medium heat. Add the diced shallot and sauté until translucent, about 2-3 minutes.
Step 7: Add the green beans to the skillet along with a generous pinch of salt and an additional pinch of chili flakes, if desired. Sauté for 1-2 minutes until the beans are vibrant green.
Step 8: Add the halved cherry tomatoes and continue cooking for another 2 minutes until the tomatoes soften slightly.
Step 9: Gently stir in the baked tofu and the remaining 1 tablespoon of coconut oil. Cook for an additional 4 minutes until the green beans are crisp-tender.

Step 10: To serve, create a base of dark leafy greens in a bowl, then top with the tofu, green beans, and tomatoes. The heat from the dish will wilt the greens slightly. Finish with cubed lemon cucumber and adjust seasoning with additional salt or chili flakes, if needed.

Arrange the salad artfully, with the diced shallot and garlic scattered for visual interest. Incorporate a lemon wedge and a sprinkle of chili flakes for garnish. recipes.name: Easy Marinated Air-Fried Tofu
ingredients: 16 ounces extra-firm tofu, pressed and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 1/2 tablespoons canola oil (or another neutral oil)
1 tablespoon sliced green onions, for garnish (optional)
directions: Step 1: Gather all the ingredients to ensure you have everything ready.

Step 2: Press the tofu by wrapping it in a clean kitchen towel and placing it on a rimmed baking sheet. Alternatively, place the tofu between layers of paper towels and set a heavy skillet, book, or cutting board on top, weighing it down with heavy cans. Allow it to stand for about 30 minutes to remove excess moisture.

Step 3: While the tofu is pressing, prepare the marinade by whisking together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, canola oil, grated ginger, brown sugar, toasted sesame oil, and minced garlic in a small bowl.
Step 4: After pressing, cut the tofu into 1-inch cubes and place them in a shallow baking dish or a non-reactive container.
Step 5: Pour the marinade mixture over the tofu cubes. Cover the dish and refrigerate for 30 minutes to 1 hour to allow the tofu to absorb the flavors.
Step 6: Preheat your air fryer to 390°F (200°C). Arrange the marinated tofu cubes in the air fryer basket in a single layer.
Step 7: Cook the tofu for about 12 to 15 minutes, turning the cubes every 3 to 4 minutes, until they are crispy and golden brown.
Step 8: Remove the tofu from the air fryer, garnish with sliced green onions if desired, and serve hot.

Incorporate fresh green onions as a garnish, and sprinkle sesame seeds for added contrast. Select a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, drawing focus to the tofu cubes. Include a small bowl of dipping sauce and a pair of chopsticks for an inviting, Asian-inspired feel.

recipes.name: Baked Tofu with Basil Cashew Pesto
ingredients: 1 teaspoon sea salt, plus more for seasoning
1 pound extra-firm tofu, pressed and cut into 1-inch cubes
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Gather all ingredients required for the recipe.
Step 2: In a food processor, combine the fresh basil leaves, minced garlic, raw cashews, nutritional yeast, fresh lemon juice, and sea salt. Pulse until finely chopped.

Step 3: While the food processor is running, gradually drizzle in the olive oil until the pesto reaches your desired consistency. Adjust seasoning with additional salt and freshly ground black pepper as needed.
Step 4: Transfer the pesto to a covered dish and refrigerate until ready to use. Any leftover pesto can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for two to three days.

Step 5: In a glass dish, gently toss the pressed tofu cubes with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and 4 to 6 tablespoons of the prepared basil cashew pesto. Cover and refrigerate for several hours or overnight to marinate.
Step 6: Before baking, ensure the tofu cubes are evenly coated by tossing them again with the marinade.
Step 7: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly oil a baking sheet or spray it with cooking spray.
Step 8: Arrange the marinated tofu cubes in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the tofu is golden brown and crispy.

Step 9: Remove the baked tofu from the oven and serve it over rice, pasta, or salad greens. Top with a dollop of the remaining basil cashew pesto and season with additional salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot or cold.

recipes.name: Crispy Tofu Spring Rolls
ingredients: 8 ounces firm or extra-firm tofu, pressed and cut into thin strips
2 tablespoons soy sauce or tamari for gluten-free
1/2 teaspoon minced or grated fresh ginger
1 cup cooked bean thread or rice vermicelli, drained
directions: Step 1: Gather all ingredients and prepare your work area.
Step 2: Press the tofu by placing it on a kitchen towel or paper towels, cover with another towel, and weigh it down with a heavy skillet or pot for 30 minutes.
Step 3: After pressing, slice the tofu into thin strips.
Step 4: Heat a skillet over medium heat, add soy sauce, olive oil, sesame oil, and minced ginger, then sauté the tofu strips for 5 to 7 minutes until lightly crisp.
Step 5: Remove the tofu from the skillet and place it on paper towels to drain excess moisture.
Step 6: In a large bowl, combine the sautéed tofu with sliced cabbage, grated carrots, and cooked noodles, and toss gently.
Step 7: Submerge a spring roll wrapper in warm water for 5 to 10 seconds until it softens slightly, then lay it on a clean board.
Step 8: Place 2 to 3 tablespoons of the tofu mixture horizontally just below the center of the wrapper.
Step 9: Add 2 to 3 mint leaves on top of the filling, then fold in the sides and tightly roll the wrapper from the bottom to the top, sealing the edges.
Step 10: Repeat the rolling process with the remaining wrappers and filling.
Step 11: Serve the spring rolls immediately, either whole or halved, with your favorite dipping sauce.

Use natural light from a nearby window to enhance the golden-brown texture of the spring rolls, casting soft shadows. Position the rolls at a slight angle, showcasing their filled interior. Incorporate a small bowl of soy sauce for dipping, and use a blurred background of lush greenery to evoke freshness, ensuring the focus remains on the deliciously crispy rolls.

recipes.name: Chocolate Tofu Pudding and Pie Filling
ingredients: 24.6 ounces firm silken tofu, drained and blended
1/4 cup granulated sugar or to taste
2 teaspoons almond extract, adjust to taste
directions: 1. Ensure the tofu is firm silken tofu and not waterpacked; brands like Mori-Nu work well.
2. In a food processor or blender, combine the drained tofu, cocoa powder, sugar, vanilla extract, and almond extract.
3. Blend the ingredients until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
4. Taste the mixture; adjust sweetness with additional sugar or other sweeteners like Splenda if desired.
5. Note that different cocoa powders may impact the texture and taste; choose a smooth, non-chalky brand.
6. Serve the mixture as pudding, or pour it into your preferred pie crust to chill and set as a pie filling.
7. For an elegant presentation, layer the pudding with fresh fruit in parfait glasses and garnish with fruit slices and mint leaves.
